paragraphs.text: Cove
Backstory

Cove and her twin, Tide, were born in a seaside village where life was as peaceful as the sea on a summer's day. Their family survived on selling what goods the sea could offer them, fish, clams, seaweeds, fishing when the weather was kind and hunting when storms roared. From the start, the twins were unlike most: water genasi blessed by the temperament of the ocean. Tide was a dreamer, lazy but full of light. Cove was dutiful, early out of bed to help their father with fishing nets and their mother house-chores.

Trouble fitting into the busy lifestyle of the family, Tide was sent away to serve in Lathander’s clergy, while Cove stayed behind helping with the family business. She missed him, but she was kept busy with fishing, hunting and preparing the day's catch for the market.
But one evening changed it all.

Returning from a late fishing trip with her mother, they were ambushed by pirates. They had no treasure, just fish from today's catch, but the pirates found the pair fascinating. Two water genasi, rare and beautiful, like mermaids pulled from the depths. Her mother fought with all her might, shoving Cove into the sea before being struck down by a drunken man. Cove’s last sight of her was blood spilling across the deck, mingling with saltwater.

Cove swam for days, alone and broken, waves helped carry her to shore. Her father wept when she told him what happened, a broken man. He called home Tide and together they buried an empty grave, but Cove’s grief festered into rage.
That night, she returned to the shoreline and begged the sea for vengeance. And the sea answered.

From the dark waters rose Neritha, a deep sea witch, her body more fishlike than human. She offered Cove the strength to hunt those who took her mother, to make her blood a weapon. Cove agreed, cutting her palm and letting her blood fall into the waves. The sea boiled crimson.

She remembers little after that, just whispers in her head, the sight of blood…. So much blood, voices guiding her hands, and the screams of dying men. When she awoke, the ship that had taken her mother was wrecked and silent, its crew torn apart by arrows of blood.

From that day forward, Cove could feel the sea in her veins and voices in her head, restless, hungry. Her bow became her conduit: when she drew, her arrows sang with power and her blood shimmered along the string.
Broken and hurt, their father retired, encouraging them to go see the world, do something good with their lives.

Now Cove travels beside her brother. She tells herself her power is under control, but sometimes, when she draws her bow and feels her blood hum with magic, she still hears Neritha’s voice in the tide, whispering:
“Child of the sea. You’ve only just begun to drown.”
TLDR:
Cove grew up seaside with her parents and twin brother.
Tide, her twin brother, was lazy and sent away to become a cleric.
Cove stayed back to help with the family business.
Returning from a fishing trip with her mother, they were attacked by pirates.
Pirates kills mother.
Tide comes home and together with their father they bury an empty casket.
Cove seeks revenge and accepts a gift from a deep sea-witch, bloodmagic.
Cove kills all the pirates while in a trans-like state of mind.
Everytime Cove taps into bloodmagic she hears voices in her head, wanting her to kill.
Their father retires and asks the twin to go experience life and do good
